TITLE: Information Technology Intern, Summer 2023
QUALIFICATIONS: Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology or related technical field. Currently in your penultimate year of study. Experience in troubleshooting applications in one or more of the following networked environments: Linux, macOS, or Windows. Understanding of LAN/WAN environments. Ability to configure, upgrade, and relocate PC hardware, software, and print devices.
DESCRIPTION: Complete technical projects with a team of Googlers and other peers. Attend training sessions to build your professional skills. Provide support for desktops/laptops, and user access to corporate networks and applications, both on the network and through remote VPN access. Support services such as office phones, mobile devices, video conferencing, and remote access. Provide basic corporate network infrastructure and server support.

TITLE: Network Test Engineer, Platforms
QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience. 8 years of industry experience with network test automation using Python or Go. Knowledge in Kubernates, CI/CD principles and understanding of Google cloud platform. Understanding of Telecom Orchestration, Assurance principles.
DESCRIPTION: Test Telecom based products (Telecom network automation, Network Service Platform and Maroni etc) from a functional as well as a scale perspective. Own and develop Automation framework for current and future telecom products. Automate the test cases that can be executed in a Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment environment from build to the canary based deployment. Triage and debug issues. Work with Engineering Product teams to make sure the required libraries and framework is ready for automating the test cases that are lined up for daily and weekly builds.

TITLE: Metro Network Deployment Engineer
QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, a related field, or equivalent practical experience. 3 years of experience in networking technologies. Experience with state and local regulatory, construction, and Environmental Health and Safety (EHS) standards, procedures, and permitting requirements. Experience working with local exchange carrier (LEC), telecom service providers, landlords, electricians, and construction operators. Experience in scripting or coding. Ability to speak and write in English fluently as well as the local language of the assigned metro. Ability to travel up to 50% of the time as needed.
DESCRIPTION: Oversee installation technicians for rack, stack, and networking equipment. Commission and test routers, optical transport equipment, and other network devices in new and existing network nodes across Google's global network. Generate implementation plans and provide technical leadership and guidance during deployment activities. Work closely with project management, network engineering, and the rest of the engineering team to identify potential problems in network installations, including in the areas of facility power (AC/DC), cooling, security and access, rack layout, and cable management. Own network documentation, and update and maintain network drawings and plans.

TITLE: Network Test Engineer, Fabric Network Testing and Infrastructure
QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, a related field, or equivalent practical experience. 3 years of experience with object-oriented programming languages (e.g., C++ or Python). 3 years of experience with testing/releasing networking products. 3 years of experience working with and testing multiple L2 and L3 networking protocols as well as troubleshooting automation. Master's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field. 4 years of experience with object-oriented programming languages (e.g., C++ or Python). 4 years of experience with testing/releasing networking products. 4 years of experience working with and testing multiple L2 and L3 networking protocols as well as troubleshooting automation. Experience in architecture and developing test infrastructure to support large scaled network solutions.
DESCRIPTION: Design, develop, and execute test plans for networking features, equipment, and systems. Design and deploy suitable test-beds for testing networking software infrastructure. Develop test automation and tools. Manage feature and resource priorities for a release (e.g., deciding priority of test cases, evaluating release-stoppers). Generate ideas to solve open-ended problems with multiple approaches to reach an optimal solution.

Experience as an IT infrastructure consultant or enterprise architect working in data center investment strategies and proposals. Experience in networking (e.g., Linux, software-defined networking, network virtualization, open protocols, application acceleration and load balancing, DNS, virtual private networks) and their application to Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS) and Infrastructure-as-a-Service (IaaS) technologies. Work with digital native and Independent Software Vendor (ISV) customers to demonstrate and prototype Google Cloud product integrations in customer/partner environments. Recommend migration strategies, enterprise architectures, migration tools, and cloud infrastructure required to successfully implement a complete solution using best practices on Google Cloud.

Lead the requirement analysis, Engineering design, and solution development of Google’s production network infrastructure.

Master's degree in Management, Technical, Engineering, or a related field. 5 years of experience in a customer-facing role interfacing with executive stakeholders, driving customer technical implementation, or transformation programs. Experience collaborating with channel partners, systems integrators, and third-party developers to deliver high-impact solutions. Knowledge of IT operations, database systems, networking, IT security, application development, service architecture, cloud-native application development, hosted services, storage systems, and content delivery networks.Ability to pass an enhanced US government background check.
DESCRIPTION: Accelerate customer adoption of Google Cloud by leading the implementation journey. Provide technical guidance and manage timelines, milestones, migration goals, and business transformation. Advocate for customer needs in order to overcome adoption blockers and drive feature development. Lead across multiple workstreams and teams to maintain customer momentum. Develop relationships with key stakeholders to understand a customer’s business and develop roadmaps. Manage business reviews and executive sessions to understand business and technical needs. Plan for customer events and launches, partner with teams to ensure customer success moments. Work with customers and support to guide issues and escalations to resolution. Develop best practices and assets based on learnings from customer engagements to support initiatives to scale through partners and accelerate Google Cloud adoption.

Experience in commodity management, contract negotiation, supplier development, manufacturing, supply chain processes, and contract negotiations. Master's degree in environmental science, engineering, sustainable business or equivalent degree (e.g., biology, chemistry, economics, finance). Experience with large-scale industrial engineering and construction programs in data center environments. Experience working with contractors and Google Customer Solution in a large infrastructure environment. Experience with supply chain delivering NetZero strategy, Carbon Free initiatives, Fuel Cells and other sustainability goals. Experience in Capital Expenditure (Capex) and working with construction contractors. Familiarity with steel processing such as roll forming, cutting, managing service centers and buying directly from steel mills.
DESCRIPTION: Develop and execute commodity strategies through close collaboration with Google engineering, commodity teams, and cross-functional teams with supplier selection processes. Define cost drivers, develop cost models and establish should cost analysis. Conduct detailed contract including comprehensive contractual agreements and ensure capacity planning and supply chain strategies are implemented to meet on time delivery. Drive Request for Proposal (RFP)/Request For Information (RFI)/Request For Questions(RFQs) and leading cross-functional teams with a supplier selection process. Serve as internal point of contact for all ongoing remediation and quality improvement programs, define multi-year Research and Development (R&D) efforts and implement supply chain and supply base improvements. Implement supply chain improvements, drive supply base improvement with supplier metrics and regular business reviews.

Evolve and scale current services and systems to meet current needs and make space for future developments. Establish team culture focused on engineering/product/operational excellence.
